results.text: Palsy: Character suffers from numerous tics, tremors, and shakes. Reduce Ahility by 1d10.
Dark-Hearted: The character grows more cruel and callous. Reduce Fellowship by 1d10
Ill-Fortuned: When using a fate point roll a d10 on a 7 or above. It does nothing, but is still lost.
Skin Affliction: The character is plagued by boils, scabs, and sores. -20 to all charm tests.
Night Eyes: Light is uncomfortable to the character. -10 to all tests made while in bright light.
Morbid: The character struggles to concentrate due to grim visions and gloomy trains of thought. Reduce Intelligence by 1d10.
Witch-Mark: The Character develops a minor deformity or mutation that is easily hideable, but obviously tainted. Some fanatics may take issue with this.
Fell Obsession: Character gains the "Obsession" Mental Disorder. However its focus is something sinister, such as collecting bones, scarification, or torture.
Hatred: The character develops an irrational hatred to a particular group or class. They will never side or aid this group unless forced to, begrudgedly

Irrational Nausea: Character is sickened at the sight of something normally innocuous, such as prayer, books, or bare flesh, and must pass a Toughness test of take -10 to all tests while in its presence.
Wasted Frame: Character becomes sickenly pale, as their muscles wither away. Reduce Strength by 1d10
Night Terrors: Character is plagued by daemonic nightmares, gains the "Horrific Nightmares" Mental Disorder.
Poor Health: The Character suffers from strange illnesses and invisible pains. Reduce Toughness by 1d10
Distrustful: The character is irrationally distrustful of others, -10 to Fellowship tests made with strangers.
Malign Sight: The character's vision tarnishes if they try to focus. Reduce Perception by 1d10
Ashen Taste: The character finds food and drink disgusting, and can barely stomach eating. Double negative effects of Fatigue.
Bloodlust: Character has an underlying murderous bloodlust. If wounded in combat, must test Willpower to not kill enemies outright, even if not intending to.
Blackouts: The Character suffers inexplicable blackouts. What occurs in these, and when they occur is up to the GM.
Strange Addiction: The Character gains an addiction in the form of a "Minor Compulsion" Mental Disorder for something freakish if found out, such as consuming blood, tears, or rose petals.
